title: Photo resize and quality enhancement website

requirements.text: Create a single-page web app that lets users upload an image (JPG/PNG/WebP) via file picker and drag-and-drop, then shows a preview and basic image information (filename, dimensions, file size).

quotes: Create a website for resize image and quality photos

acceptanceCriteria: User can upload by clicking to choose a file or by drag-and-drop.
After upload, the app shows an image preview and displays current width×height and approximate file size.
Unsupported file types are rejected with a clear error message.

requirements.text: Implement image resizing controls that allow the user to set target width/height, maintain aspect ratio toggle, and choose a resize mode (fit/contain vs fill/cover), then apply the resize and update the preview.

quotes: Create a website for resize image and quality photos

acceptanceCriteria: User can set width and height values; when aspect ratio lock is enabled, changing one updates the other.
Resize mode selection changes how the output is computed (contain vs cover).
Clicking an Apply/Resize action regenerates the preview at the new dimensions.

requirements.text: Provide “photo quality” enhancement controls implemented client-side (no external AI services), including at minimum: sharpen, brightness, contrast, saturation, and a “reduce noise”/smoothing control; applying enhancements must update the preview and be reversible (reset to original).

quotes: Create a website for resize image and quality photos

acceptanceCriteria: Enhancement sliders exist for sharpen, brightness, contrast, saturation, and smoothing/noise reduction.
User can apply adjustments and see the preview update accordingly.
A Reset button restores the original uploaded image (before resize/enhancement).

requirements.text: Allow users to export/download the processed image with format options (PNG and JPEG at minimum) and, for JPEG/WebP outputs, a quality slider (e.g., 1–100).

quotes: Create a website for resize image and quality photos

acceptanceCriteria: When JPEG is selected, a quality control is shown and affects the downloaded file size/quality.
Clicking Download saves the processed image locally with a sensible filename (e.g., originalname-processed.jpg).

requirements.text: Add a clear, consistent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a photo tool; avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: UI uses a coherent theme (background, surfaces, typography, buttons, inputs) consistently across the page.
Layout looks intentional on both mobile and desktop.

requirements.text: Use generated static brand assets in the UI (logo and a subtle background texture) by placing them in frontend/public/assets/generated and referencing them directly from the frontend.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are rendered in the UI (e.g., logo in header, texture in background).
The app loads and displays these assets without involving the backend.

constraints: Do not use external AI/LLM services for photo enhancement; all processing must be done locally in the browser.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or the immutable hook entrypoints listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Persistent storage of user images on the backend.

required: Minimal flat logo combining a photo/camera motif with resize arrows, dark/neutral palette (logo-photo-resizer.dim_512x512.png)
Subtle repeating background texture with light grain and geometric shapes, neutral warm gray tones (bg-texture.dim_1600x900.png)
